document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the endemic Hawaiian genus Thyrocopa (Lepidoptera: Xyloryctidae: Xyloryctinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the endemic Hawaiian genus Thyrocopa (Lepidoptera: Xyloryctidae: Xyloryctinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Psychra brevipalpis
Walsingham, 1907 b
: 490
, plate 14 , fig. 5 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lectotype :
Thyrocopa brevipalpis
: UNITED STATES : HAWAII: Kauai : Kaholuamano, 4000 ’ [ 1219 m ]: 1 3 (slide 4158 BMNH , wings and genitalia),
Apr 1895
, Perkins ( BMNH ), designated by
Zimmerman 1978
: figs. 651, 672 (as “ holotype ”).

Paralectotypes :
Thyrocopa brevipalpis
: UNITED STATES : HAWAII: Kauai : Mts. 3000–4000 ’ [ 914–1219 m ]: 3 3 (slide # 2 ; one missing abdomen),
Jun 1894
, Perkins ( BPBM ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thyrocopa brevipalpis (Walsingham)
;
Zimmerman, 1978
: 984
, figs. 651, 672 , plate 4 , fig. 7 .

Psychra phycidiformis
Walsingham, 1907 b
: 490
, plate 14 , fig. 4 . Type species of Psychra .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lectotype :
Thyrocopa phycidiformis
: UNITED STATES : HAWAII: Kauai : Mts. 3000–4000 ’ [ 914–1219 m ]: 1 3 (slide 4159 BMNH ),
Jun 1894
, Perkins ( BMNH ) designated by
Zimmerman, 1978
: figs. 647, 663, 678 (as “ holotype ”).

Paralectotypes :
Thyrocopa phycidiformis
: UNITED STATES : HAWAII: Kauai : Mts. 3000–4000 ’ [ 914–1219 m ]: 3 3 (slide 2045 BMNH ) (one missing abdomen), 3 Ƥ (slide 2046 BMNH ),
May–Jun 1894
, Perkins ( BMNH ); Mts. 3000–4000 ’ [ 914–1219 m ]: 1 3 (slide 86559 ),
Jun 1894
, Perkins ( USNM ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Thyrocopa phycidiformis (Walsingham)
;
Zimmerman, 1978
: 989
, figs. 647, 663, 667, 678, 693.
NEW SYNONYMY .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis : This species has the third segment of labial palpus much shorter (ca. 0.2–0.4x length of second) than in any other
Thyrocopa
species.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Food plants : M.L. Henneman reared a larva from
Hedyotis terminalis
(Hawaiian = manono) (information on the label of a pinned specimen at the BPBM ).

Remarks : This species has a remarkably variable wing pattern (
Figs. 16–19
), but also see the accounts for
Thyrocopa
sp. A and B.
